plugins.name: Select Every 2nd Item
plugins.description:
Designed for scenarios involving data tables with numerous rows, this plugin enables you to assign a distinct background color to every second item, creating a zebra striping effect for improved table scanning.


However, the plugin can be used for other use cases as well.


Upon executing the plugin, you have the choice to begin with either the first or second item in the group or frame.
plugins.tagline: Perfect for applying zebra striping to data tables rows

plugins.name: Better Node Inspector
plugins.description:
Better Node Inspector by Dualite, offers a range of capabilities for examining node properties. The interface streamlines the process of inspecting node characteristics.


Users can access general properties, positional attributes, flex and auto-layout settings, fill properties, view child elements, and explore additional properties not covered in the main categories


Open-source repo: https://github.com/dualiteindia/better-node-inspector


  1. The plugin utilizes the async Figma API
  2. Node child elements are only loaded when the user clicks on the children dropdown, significantly enhancing plugin performance and making it super fast.


Usage

Simply select a node in your project, and Better Node Inspector will display its properties in an easy-to-navigate interface.

accepted.name: Dualite
accepted.description: 🍜 Figma plugin for converting interactive prototypes to code

plugins.tagline: Better Node Inspector by Dualite is a plugin designed to help developers inspect a given Figma Node.

plugins.name: Palette to Variable
plugins.description:
Palette to Variable streamlines your design system color management by automatically generating professional color variations from a single base color.


Key Features:

• Generate up to 20 perfectly balanced color shades

• Preview all variations before generating

• Create color variables automatically in your chosen collection

• Get instant documentation with color values and usage

• Supports both light and dark themes


Perfect for:

• Design System Engineers

• UI/UX Designers

• Design Teams

• Brand Developers


Save hours of manual color creation while maintaining consistency across your design system. Simply choose your base color, preview the generated shades, and let the plugin handle the rest - from variable creation to documentation.


Built with Figma's native variable system for seamless integration into your workflow. No external dependencies, no complex setup - just efficient color system generation when you need it.
plugins.tagline: Generate Color Systems, Effortlessly

110984.name: Palette to Variable
110984.description:

plugins.name: Ideas Spark Booth・Private Brainstorming & Retrospective Sessions
plugins.description:
Ideas Spark Booth is currently in beta. We welcome your feedback.


Ideas Spark Booth empowers your team with a powerful FigJam and Slides plugin for conducting focused brainstorming and retrospective sessions with complete participant privacy.


---


Share your ideas and submit your feedback at a single place: ideas-spark-booth.canny.io


---


Why Ideas Spark Booth


Engage with Better Brainstorming Activities

○ Set clear collaboration guidelines and establish time limits to maintain focus

○ Organize ideas into simple categories

○ Use FigJam for live brainstorming or Slides for instant team feedback


Enable Efficient Ideas Sharing

○ Track participation and engagement in real-time

○ Focus on creativity without interruptions

○ Review and refine before sharing


Present and Analyze the Insights

○ Look back at past brainstorming sessions

○ Export session data into presentation slides

○ Save your results as spreadsheets


Publish & Explore Activities

○ Store activities in the cloud

○ Share with other users

○ Browse and use community activities


---


Useful Links


Have Help

○ Read the documentation

○ Contact support


Get Involved

○ Submit feedback

○ Request a feature


Give Support

○ Follow the author


---


If you find Ideas Spark Booth useful, please share it with your colleagues!


---


○ Browser complete compatibility: Figma Desktop App, Google Chrome, Opera, Microsoft Edge, and other Chromium-based browsers

○ Partial compatibility: Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari


---


The plugin is open-source. Feel free to both watch or fork the repository, or request a merge.


Made by Aurélien Grimaud, Senior Product Designer based in Paris.
plugins.tagline: Engage & Enable your participants through private team sessions for brainstorming and retrospectives

plugins.name: My Color Palette
plugins.description:
My Color Palette 🌈

Unleash your creativity with precision color selection and easily navigate the world of colors.


No more guesswork, get the perfect color every time

Say goodbye to relying on intuition to pick colors—My Color Palette gives you control over your palette and opens up new creative possibilities. Here’s how it works:


  1. Extract colors directly from any Figma element with a simple click, ensuring perfect consistency in your designs.
  2. Use the brand-new color picker to fine-tune your selection and quickly make adjustments to your design.
  3. Generate various shades, tints, gradients, and complementary colors, adding depth and dimension to your projects.


Save once, use anytime

  1. Save your favorite colors and easily access them next time without hassle.
  2. Your saved palettes can be used across all your Figma and FigJam files. Simply drag and drop them into your projects for seamless design workflows.


Unlock unlimited features with a one-time upgrade

For a one-time payment of $9.9, enjoy unlimited usage and unlock future updates. Plus, you can store your color palettes in the cloud and access them from anywhere.


✨ Not satisfied with your purchase? You can always contact the Figma team for a refund.


Three easy steps to get started

  1. Open the plugin and select an element with a fill or stroke.
  2. Click “Active” to extract the element's color.
  3. Use the color picker or palette generated by the plugin to modify the element’s color.


Pro tips to enhance your workflow

  1. Need the color code? Just click the clipboard icon to copy the hex value instantly.
  2. Found a color you love? Save it by clicking the star icon and access it later.
  3. Keep clicking “Update” to generate fresh color palettes based on your current selection, ensuring your creativity flows uninterrupted.
  4. Drag and rearrange your saved swatches for better organization.
plugins.tagline: Unleash Your Creativity with Effortless Color Harmony!

plugins.name: Row Column Styler
plugins.description:
Row Column Styler is your go-to plugin for streamlining design workflows when dealing with tables, grids, or any layout that involves rows and columns. Here's what you can expect from the plugin:


- 🎨 Customizable Colors: Apply your desired colors to even and odd rows or columns effortlessly.

- 📏 Automatic Alignment: Use the *tidy-up* feature to neatly align and distribute rows or columns, making your designs pixel-perfect.

- 👀 Live Preview: See how your colors and layouts will look in real-time with our interactive preview.

- 🖱️ User-Friendly Interface: Switch between row and column styling with a simple click—no complex settings required.

- ⚡ Quick Application: Apply styles instantly with the "Apply" button, saving you time on repetitive tasks.


Whether you're creating data tables or stylized layouts, Row Column Styler makes the process smoother and faster.
plugins.tagline: "Effortlessly style and preview rows or columns in Figma with custom colors and alignment."

102179.name: Row Column Styler
102179.description:
Row Column Styler is your go-to plugin for streamlining design workflows when dealing with tables, grids, or any layout that involves rows and columns. Here's what you can expect from the plugin:

- 📏 Automatic Alignment: Use the *tidy-up* feature to neatly align and distribute rows or columns, making your designs pixel-perfect.

- 👀 Live Preview: See how your colors and layouts will look in real-time with our interactive preview.

- 🖱️ User-Friendly Interface: Switch between row and column styling with a simple click—no complex settings required.

- ⚡ Quick Application: Apply styles instantly with the "Apply" button, saving you time on repetitive tasks.


Whether you're creating data tables or stylized layouts, Row Column Styler makes the process smoother and faster.
102179.tagline: "Effortlessly style and preview rows or columns in Figma with custom colors and alignment."

plugins.name: Zimmar - Accessibility Compliance Checker
plugins.description:
Zimmar is a free Figma plugin that checks for accessibility compliance issues and helps you fix them.


Many designers face challenges in spotting issues like small text, poor color contrast, or improperly spaced touch targets. I wanted to build a tool that would empower designers to spot and fix these issues right within Figma.


Zimmar is designed to seamlessly integrate with Figma and provide designers with quick, actionable insights.


Here’s how it helps:


  1. Scans your design for font size, contrast, and touch target issues.
  2. Flags areas where improvements are needed based on accessibility standards like WCAG.
  3. Provides suggestions to help you fix issues and improve your designs right away.
  4. Provides accessibility compliance overview on a single selection.
  5. Generates CSV or JSON reports of detected issues for further analysis.


This plugin isn’t just about checking boxes - it’s about raising awareness and making accessibility an integral part of the design process. By addressing these issues early, I strongly believe, we can create experiences that are truly inclusive and reach a wider audience.


Your comments and feedback are appreciated!
plugins.tagline: Scan your designs for font size, contrast, and touch target issues and resolve them instantly

126249.name: Zimmar - Accessibility Compliance Checker
126249.description:
Zimmar is a free Figma plugin that checks for accessibility compliance issues and helps you fix them.


Many designers face challenges in spotting issues like small text, poor color contrast, or improperly spaced touch targets. I wanted to build a tool that would empower designers to spot and fix these issues right within Figma.


Zimmar is designed to seamlessly integrate with Figma and provide designers with quick, actionable insights.


Here’s how it helps:


  1. Scans your design for font size, contrast, and touch target issues.
  2. Flags areas where improvements are needed based on accessibility standards like WCAG.
  3. Provides suggestions to help you fix issues and improve your designs right away.

plugins.name: Bulk image exporter
plugins.description:
Speed up your workflow by exporting all images from your Figma page in just one click! This plugin collects every image and packs them into a handy ZIP file — no more exporting one by one.


You can also set a size limit (default: 1MB) to automatically compress images without losing too much quality. Perfect for quick exporting, sharing assets with devs and optimizing performance.


Features:


  1. Export all images on the current page in a ZIP file
  2. Set max size per image (e.g. 1MB or less)
  3. Check the current download status.
  4. Download each image individually


👉 Please note: this plugin is currently in beta, feedback is welcome!

accepted.name: Lorenzo Brandimarte
accepted.description: Web and UI Designer | No-code developer

plugins.tagline: Export every image on your page in a single ZIP

135102.name: Bulk image exporter
135102.description:
Speed up your workflow by exporting all images from your Figma page in just one click! This plugin collects every image and packs them into a handy ZIP file — no more exporting one by one.


You can also set a size limit (default: 1MB) to automatically compress images without losing too much quality. Perfect for quick exporting, sharing assets with devs and optimizing performance.


Features:


  1. Export all images on the current page in a ZIP file
  2. Set max size per image (e.g. 1MB or less)
  3. Check the current download status.
  4. Download each image individually


👉 Please note: this plugin is currently in beta, feedback is welcome!
135102.release_notes: Version 1.0.3 - Plugin now works even if you haven't selected a frame first.
135102.tagline: Export every image on your page in a single ZIP

plugins.name: Figma to Creatopy
plugins.description:
Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy—work faster, collaborate better, and scale effortlessly.


Key Features


  1. Quick Import:

Easily import selected Figma frames into a project and folder of your choice in Creatopy.

  1. Import as single design or set: Set import is available for multiple identical frames provided the layers have the same name and are of the same type.
  2. Smart Layer Mapping: Figma layers (images, text, shapes) are auto-converted to matching Creatopy layers.
  3. Editable Elements: All imported elements stay editable—tweak designs, animate, or scale with automation.
  4. Preserved Structure: Figma’s nested groups stay intact, keeping your design organized and easy to navigate.



Current Version Limitations


  1. Frame properties are removed; frames become groups.
  2. No support for auto layout and constraints.
  3. Limited support for blend modes, strokes, effects, gradients, and corner radius.



Streamline your process. Scale your creativity. Try “Figma to Creatopy” and design smarter from the start.
plugins.tagline: Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy.

136819.name: Figma to Creatopy
136819.description:
Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy—work faster, collaborate better, and scale effortlessly.


Key Features


  1. Quick Import:

Easily import selected Figma frames into a project and folder of your choice in Creatopy.

  1. Import as single design or set: Set import is available for multiple identical frames provided the layers have the same name and are of the same type.
  2. Smart Layer Mapping: Figma layers (images, text, shapes) are auto-converted to matching Creatopy layers.
  3. Editable Elements: All imported elements stay editable—tweak designs, animate, or scale with automation.
  4. Preserved Structure: Figma’s nested groups stay intact, keeping your design organized and easy to navigate.



Current Version Limitations


  1. Frame properties are removed; frames become groups.
  2. No support for auto layout and constraints.
  3. Limited support for blend modes, strokes, effects, gradients, and corner radius.



Streamline your process. Scale your creativity. Try “Figma to Creatopy” and design smarter from the start.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to access the Creatopy API to generate ads and fetch fonts. The plugin also needs to access Figma's API to create and manipulate design elements.

136819.release_notes:
We’ve added several improvements in this update:
- Optimized the asset upload process for better performance
- Resolved rotation issues for elements nested in rotated groups
- The plugin now considers only the first visible fill property of each layer
- Fixed issues related to mapping font attributes and styles
- Added support for multi-line text layers
136819.tagline: Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy.

plugins.name: Figma Audit Annotations
plugins.description:
The Audit Annotations Figma's plugin allows your team to collaboratively run a full usability, accessibility or ecodesign audit by adding qualified annotations to your workflows' screens using well-known referentials such Bastien & Scapin usability heuristics (others to come).


The plugin automatically calculates a score for each screen and for the whole audited application.


Finally, you can export all your annotations into an actionable audit file for your clients. (Not yet available)


More details on the dedicated page: https://alconis.com/ressources/figma_audit_annotations_plugin/


This plugin will be regularly improved based on community feedbacks.

accepted.name: Nicolas Demange
accepted.description: French Product Designer... and developer! Saving the world. One screen at a time.

plugins.tagline: Annotate your screens with usability, accessibility and ecodesign referentials.

plugins.name: Gradient Generator
plugins.description:
Gradient Generator

This Figma plugin enables designers to effortlessly create gradient-based square patterns. Select two squares with different colors, input the number of squares you'd like generated, and the plugin will automatically produce an array of squares, each shaded with an interpolated color between the two selected hues. This tool is ideal for designing color palettes, gradient backgrounds, or visualizing color transitions in your projects.


Features:

- Color Selection: Pick two squares to use as color anchors.

- Customizable Quantity: Enter the number of gradient squares you'd like to generate.

- Automatic Placement: Squares are aligned in a row for easy visual comparison.

- Smooth Color Interpolation: Each generated square shows a seamless color transition.


Simplify your color design workflow and add gradient-based color arrays with just a few clicks!
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin to generate gradient squares by selecting two colors and setting the quantity.

107039.name: Gradient Generator

This tool is ideal for designing color palettes, gradient backgrounds, or visualizing color transitions in your projects.

- Customizable Quantity: Enter the number of gradient squares you'd like to generate.

Simplify your color design workflow and add gradient-based color arrays with just a few clicks!

plugins.name: Geometric Tile Pattern SVG Generator
plugins.description:
Geometric Pattern Generator is a Figma plugin for creating beautiful, customizable geometric patterns. Built for designers who need professional-quality patterns fast, this plugin provides generation with granular control.


Key Features:


  1. Smart Generation: Instantly create unique patterns with randomized settings or manually adjust rows, columns, block size, colors, and big blocks chances
  2. Multiple Export Options: Download as PNG or SVG, or insert patterns directly into your Figma canvas as vector or raster graphics
  3. Developer-Friendly: View and copy HTML & CSS code, raw SVG markup, or URL-encoded versions for seamless web integration
  4. Smooth Workflow: Intuitive interface with real-time preview, smooth animations, and one-click generation


Perfect for creating backgrounds, textures, brand elements, or decorative graphics. Generate backgrounds for apps, websites, presentations, or print materials, get professional geometric patterns that would take hours to create manually – in just seconds.

From concept to code, this plugin bridges the gap between design and development, making it essential for modern design workflows.

accepted.description:

https://shop.plusuidesign.com/

plugins.name: Symplr.io - Figma to a working App in minutes
plugins.description:
What is Symplr.io?

Symplr.io is a cutting-edge low-code platform designed to empower anyone to create production-ready web and mobile apps effortlessly. Symplr.io allows users to rapidly compose innovative apps covering a broad range of domains such as fintech, open finance & e-commerce.


What Does This Plugin Do?

The Symplr.io - Figma to Functional App Instantly plugin bridges the gap between design and development. It enables the users to convert a Figma design into a working app by seamlessly importing the Figma design into the Symplr Studio. The users can extend the imported app by adding API workflows and business logic within Symplr Studio.


What Can You Do in Symplr.io Studio?

  1. Add Logic & APIs: Use Symplr's intuitive low-code tools to define business logic and integrate APIs, leveraging the Arazzo Workflow Specification for seamless API integrations.
  2. Build, Test, & Deploy: Build your app, test its functionality, and deploy the code directly to your GitHub repository.


How to Use the Plugin

  1. Install the Symplr.io - Figma to Functional App Instantly plugin from the Figma Marketplace.
  2. Using the plugin interface, tag your Figma components to match Symplr’s widget library.
  3. Import your tagged Figma designs to Symplr.io.
  4. View your auto-generated app.
  5. Enhance your app by adding business logic and APIs (Arazzo specification-based workflows).
  6. Build and test your mobile app directly from Symplr.io.

Note: Currently, Symplr.io supports mobile apps with React Native.


Create your next mobile app seamlessly, from design to deployment, with Symplr.io! (https://studio.symplr.io)
plugins.tagline: Instantly convert Figma designs into production-ready, mobile apps.

plugins.name: Cham Multi-language Translator
plugins.description:
🌟 Introducing the Ultimate Figma Translation Plugin! 🌟


Say goodbye to language barriers and hello to seamless, multilingual designs! Our Figma Translation Plugin is here to revolutionize your workflow, making it easier than ever to create global-ready designs.


✨ Key Features:

🎯 Flexible Selection: Translate selected text, groups, frames, pages, or even your entire design.

✨ Quick Actions: Translate text in a snap—all with just one click!

🌍 Multilingual Output: Supports a wide range of languages to cater to global audiences.

⏱️ Bulk Edit: Save time by editing multiple text layers simultaneously.

🚀 Instant Translation: Translate text layers or entire pages in a single click—no hassle, no delays.


Whether you're working with global teams, freelancing for international clients, or designing for a multilingual audience, this plugin is your go-to solution for efficient and professional translations.


👉 Try it now and experience the difference!


Got feedback or questions? We’d love to hear from you! Reach out to us at cham@idgpt.my.id


#Figma #DesignTools #TranslationPlugin #UXDesign #DesignCommunity


Let’s make your designs speak every language! 🌍✨

plugins.name: SelectLock
plugins.description:
💪🏽 Take control of your Figma layers with SelectLock!


SelectLock is your secret weapon for maintaining design integrity in Figma. This powerful plugin lets you lock multiple layers in one go while keeping specific layer types editable.


Here's what you can do:


  1. Bulk lock layers across your entire Figma file
  2. Cherry-pick which layer types stay unlocked
  3. Use a simple checkbox interface for layer selection
  4. Lock your design with just one click
  5. Keep your layer structure intact


Perfect for designers who want to secure their work without sacrificing flexibility. Whether you're polishing a final design or collaborating with a team, SelectLock helps you stay in control. Say goodbye to the tedious task of locking layers one by one. With SelectLock, you're the boss of your design file!


👉🏼 Click here to drop a feedback

👉🏼 Send me a mail


Thank you for using SelectLock.


👉🏼 How to Use


  1. Select the frame or group containing the layers you want to lock
  2. Run the Selectlock plugin from the Plugins menu
  3. In the plugin interface, check the boxes next to any layer types you want to lock/unlock
  4. Click the "Lock/Unlock" button
  5. All checked layer types will be locked/unlocked, while unchecked layer types remain editable/uneditable.
plugins.tagline: Lock specific layer types in bulk. Keep designing freely.

plugins.name: QuickFrame
plugins.description:
QuickFrame is your new best friend in Figma, helping you skip the fuss and get straight to designing. Need the perfect size for a Facebook post, YouTube thumbnail, or anything in between? QuickFrame has you covered with ready-made frames that match all the popular dimensions. No more guessing or manually resizing—just pick a frame and start creating!


Why You’ll Love QuickFrame:


Ready-Made Frames: We’ve done the hard work for you with preset sizes for social media, print, mobile, and more.

Easy Tweaks: Customize dimensions, resolution, and background colors with just a few clicks—because your design should be exactly how you want it.

Super Simple: It’s quick, it’s easy, and it fits right into your Figma workflow, so you can focus on what you do best.

Saves You Time: Get your designs sized and ready in no time, so you can focus on your creativity.

QuickFrame is here to make your design process smoother and faster—so you can spend more time creating and less time fiddling with dimensions. Give it a try and see how much easier your projects can be!
plugins.tagline: QuickFrame: Your Go-To Tool for Perfectly Sized Designs

plugins.name: Orange Tokens: Themes & Variables
plugins.description:
Description

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades — instantly and intelligently. Now with Typography Token support, you can generate consistent, scalable color and type systems right inside Figma.


Whether you're building a new design system or scaling an existing one, Orange Tokens eliminates guesswork and manual setup — so you can focus on design, not variables.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork — Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.


🚀 How to use

  1. Enter your base colors and name them
  2. Choose how many display/text styles you want
  3. Click “Generate Variables”
  4. Orange Tokens generates color variables and synced text styles automatically


✨ Features

  1. One-click color palette generation
  2. Auto-generated tints & shades from base colors
  3. Typography tokens + text styles generated together
  4. Organized variables with design token–friendly naming
  5. Great for theming, dark/light modes, and scalable systems
  6. Fast, clean, and easy — even at scale


⚙️ How it works

Orange Tokens uses structured algorithms to create harmonious tints, shades, and typography styles from your input. Each color or text style is mapped to a logical name and stored as a Figma variable — ready for use across your entire system.


Everything updates in a few clicks — no broken styles, no messy overrides.


💬 Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning — future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!
plugins.tagline: Design Token Generator for Color & Typography

Everything updates in a few clicks — no broken styles, no messy overrides.


💬 Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning — future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!
137665.release_notes:
Bug Fixes:

- Font Name variables weren't binding with the Typography styles
137665.tagline: Design Token Generator for Color & Typography

🎨 Design smarter. Fix faster. Elevate your UI. 🚀

plugins.name: Consistent contacts
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to create your own data structure (text or image) and than fill the data into your frames based on matching layer and key name. You have to have the data structure in a predefined JSON format. Example:

{

"records": [

{

"photo": { "image": "avatar-01.jpg" },

"name": "John Doe",

"id": "1234",

"phone": "+1 110-1234",

"company": "TechNova Inc.",

"position": "Software Engineer",

"email": "john.doe@technova.com"

}

]

}

The JSON can be ZIPped with images to a single file, which you can drop to the plugin and populate the frames. The populated frames have to be wrapped together in a parent frame or a component instance works as well. All the frames or instances have to be selected directly to be populated correctly.


WEBP image format is not supported by Figma. JPG and PNG formats works. The whole ZIP file has to be smaller than 1MB, which is a memory limit for any plugin. The ZIP file is remembered, even if you close the plugin, but it is removed from memory and replaced by a new one, if you select a new file.


Not being a developer myself, this is my very first attempt to create a Figma plugin with a huge help from AI. I was able to make it into a working prototype, but there might still be some glitches. If the plugin does not work correctly, check the ZIP content, JSON structure and correct naming of the images. If the plugin stops to work, try to "Clear memory" via a dedicated button. It should reset everything and clean the memory of the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Fill in consistent connected data to your frames
